title: Compiler panic caused by power_assert
body:
My compiler panics consistently when I use power_assert and override the builtin asserts.

I tried this code:
# ![feature(plugin)]
# ![plugin(power_assert(override_builtins))]
# [cfg(test)]

mod tests {
    #[test]
    fn test_equal() {
        assert!(vec![":)"] == vec![":)"]);
    }
}

I expected to see this happen: code compiles

Instead, this happened: compiler panics
## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
rustc 1.11.0-nightly (1c975eafa 2016-06-05)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 1c975eafa934e291e4f94b7252faae767de17313
commit-date: 2016-06-05
host: x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
release: 1.11.0-nightly

Backtrace:

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
